manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Braun BrewSense 12-Cup Drip Coffee Maker KF7000BK Like the perfect brew, quality lies in the details. Braun’s BrewSense 12-cup Drip Coffee Maker, model KF7000BK, blends thoughtful design and reliability for rich, bold coffee in the comfort of your home. Braun’s years of brewing knowledge, attention to detail and unique PureFlavor system bring out all of the savory richness and flavor that make for a satisfying coffee experience. The streamlined design and sleek black finish allow Braun's BrewSense Coffee Maker to be the perfect complement to any contemporary kitchen. For the ultimate in precision, the unique carafe lid seals in flavor, while the anti-drip system allows you to pour any time during the brewing cycle. A fully automatic 24-hour programmable timer means your much-needed first cup of coffee will be waiting for you when you want it. Once the familiar aroma of freshly ground, brewed coffee fills your kitchen, you know something special awaits. Discover rich, fresh-brewed coffee every day, with Braun.

Key Features Satisfaction In Every Cup With Braun’s innovative PureFlavor system, your coffee is made at the right temperature and the right brewing time to extract the best coffee flavor and aroma. Keep The Flavor Inside The unique carafe lid seals in the fresh flavor by minimizing air exposure and the anti-drip system lets you pour with precision – anytime during the brewing cycle. Digital Control Panel The digital control panel buttons are displayed in the same way you read – from left to right.

Wake Up To A Fresh Pot Reliable clock with a fully automatic 24-hour programmable timer means your much-needed first cup of coffee will be waiting for you when you want it. No More Messy Counters The coffee maker features a unique ledge on its back side to collect the condensation that gathers from the brewing process and inserts it back into the machine, no more messy spills of water on your counters. Small In Size, Big In Flavor The streamlined design and fully enclosed carafe help minimize wasted space while maximizing your coffee experience. The condensation drip tray ensures the water stays where it belongs – inside the coffee maker.

PureFlavor Brewing System ✓ ✓ Adjustable Strength Settings – Regular/Bold Keep-Warm Settings – Low/Medium/High 24-Hour Programmable Timer ✓ ✓ Self-Clean ✓ ✓ 1-4 Cup Setting ✓ ✓ 12-Cup Flavor Carafe ✓ ✓ Anti-Drip System ✓ ✓ Removable Cone-Shaped Filter Basket ✓ ✓ Coffee Measuring Scoop ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, easy to use, great flavor, good features
reviews.reviewText: I've used electric drip coffee makers for the past 40 years. Always a cone filter. Always a paper filter. This Braun automatic drip coffee maker is easy to fill, easy to clean, makes great coffee very quickly*. I've had this a bit over a month. It took a few brews to dial in the amount of beans to grind (about 5-10% more than in my previous machine) and the amount of time* to grind the beans (about 35% longer than for previous machine). Features are nice and easy to use. Very satisfied. Quality, solid product as you would expect from Braun. *I found that I had to grind longer to get a finer grind since the machine brews so quickly. You'll want to have finer grounds for the water to drip through. The finer grounds slow down the drip and lets the coffee brew properly. Otherwise you'll get a weak pot of coffee w/ the same amount of grounds. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2016
reviews.reviewText: This makes the best tasting coffee of any coffeemaker I've ever owned. Smooth tasting and nice and hot right after brewing--you don't have to let it sit on the burner plate to get hot. I use the charcoal filters and I think that has a LOT to do with the great taste, but using them is optional. I have never cared for the gold tone filter that a lot of coffeemakers come with, so I just don't use it. I much prefer paper filters, and this takes the #4 cone filters. Easy to program, VERY nice, sleek design, and as another reviewer stated, the pot slides easily in and out--doesn't get hung up on the drip mechanism. It brews quietly, and it does not beep at all when starting or finishing. That never bothered me with my other coffeemakers, but I don't miss it either-lol. I know some people find the beeping to be annoying. The green LED light came on when it was time to clean, which in my case was five (5) weeks after I started using it, so I expect it to always be about the same. So when I clean it, that's when I change the charcoal filter--makes it easy to keep track of. A lot of people will be able to go longer than 5 weeks, but I have VERY hard water. I used vinegar, not a commercial cleaner, and it works great. This is replacing a Mr. Coffee that was really great--for the whole 4 1/2 years that it worked! Braun is a good name, a good brand, and I expect to get several years out of it! Buy it--you won't be sorry!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Depend on Braun
reviews.reviewText: My last Braun coffeemaker lasted 20-25 years (I lost track). Until it didn’t. One morning I filled it up, turned it on, and nothing — no noise, no sputtering, no leaking, just the glow of its little forlorn light and clock. So when I went looking for a replacement, I considered no brand but Braun. I didn’t need a 14 cupper, and the 12 cup version in black was less expensive than stainless steel. Besides, the ancient one was black. It works great, makes good coffee, just like my old workhorse. I didn’t really need 12 cups, but I appreciate the 1-4 cup adjuster. It does appear to do … something. Did I mention my old coffeemaker died the day before Thanksgiving? Bless, Amazon, the new one arrived on Friday well in time for Saturday morning coffee.A few design deficits, proving that newer is not always better:- It’s hard to tell exactly where to pour the water into the reservoir and easy to miss. Been there, done that, already.- I figured out how to remove the filter basket, but I feared breaking it on my first attempt. Once out, I learned it won’t stand up on its own for filling. (The ancient one did.) That means either prop it up (on what, pray tell?!) or fill it in place. The problem with filling in place? Before I’ve had my coffee, my aim isn’t always spot on. And I have no idea how to get errant coffee grounds out of the water reservoir where I’m sure they will wreak havoc.- The clock is so dim as to be virtually worthless.- This unit is a bunch bigger — taller, wider, hulkier — than my earlier model. Why?But still, Braun makes a damn good cuppa coffee. And that’s the real test, right?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great set up for cost. Reusable solid filter!
reviews.reviewText: For price in modern day, cood soilf coffee maker. No drip stop, no bells n whistles, its also rather slow. This however, makes it aall the better. I dont love the pot, but cost effective. Rest is well made, looks good, cleans. Filters NOT NEEDED. Has reusable Filter! So its a great slow brew tvat qdds flavor. Dont expect the high cost add ons, just soild, good amount of good coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee maker is very well built, and very easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: Very well built...love the pause and serve which works very well...it doesn't drip.I would recommend this coffee maker.

I am not a connoisseur but I do enjoy a good cup of joe. Enough to tell when the one they serve me at the restaurant is bad or old. I also have my own burr grinder. I switched from a flat basket to this one, which is conical. If you are doing the same, reduce grind size or else you will think this machine doesn’t make good coffee. I have the oxo grinder and currently it is set at 6.

I am still in the hunt for a coffee pot that serves HOT coffee. The only difference this pot is to the others I have had (3 Cuisnart) is that I can adjust how long the hot plate stays on. I set mine to 3 hours. This pot does not sound to signal coffee is ready. Does not have a BOLD option. It is sleek & I like the look of it. I only bought to replace the one I had that was functional but the coffee again was not as hot as I would like. I have tried the pots that have a thermal decanter which is useless unless you heat the thermos with hot water prior using. Even then not great. I change my coffee pot every 2 years regardless if it is working or not. Thought pricing up would make a difference. At the end of the day this is a very very basic coffee maker. On a good note it has a good warranty.
This is a basic coffee maker with a timer. It does what it’s supposed to do. Can accommodate #4 filters but it doesn’t need them.
